title: 108_hr1527
content:
The Act may be cited as the "National Transportation Safety Board Reauthorization Act of 2003" and authorizes appropriations. Authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 2003-2006, including specific amounts for each year and for the NTSB Academy. Additional funds authorized for emergency purposes. SEC. 3. ACCIDENT AND SAFETY DATA CLASSIFICATION AND PUBLICATION. Amends Section 1119 of title 49, United States Code, to include procedures for appealing determinations of aircraft accidents by Board employees. Appeals can be made to the Board, with limitations on applicability in cases resulting in loss of life.

SEC. 4. SECRETARY OF TRANSPORTATION'S RESPONSES TO SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS. Section 1135(d) of title 49, United States Code is amended to require the Secretary to submit an annual report to Congress and the Board on the regulatory status of safety recommendations. If the report is not received by March 1, the Board will notify relevant committees. The Secretary must submit an annual report to Congress and the Board on safety recommendations, including those on the 'most wanted list' and 15-passenger van, railroad grade crossing, and commercial driver's license safety. This requirement will end after the report due on February 1, 2008. SEC. 5. ASSISTANCE TO FAMILIES OF PASSENGERS INVOLVED IN AIRCRAFT ACCIDENTS. The text amends Section 1136 of title 49, United States Code, regarding the relinquishment of investigative priority in aircraft accidents. It states that the National Transportation Safety Board shall assist the Federal agency to which investigative priority has been relinquished in providing assistance to victims and families. Additionally, it requires a revision of the Memorandum of Understanding between the NTSB and the relevant agencies within a year of the Act's enactment. After the enactment of this Act, the National Transportation Safety Board and the Federal Bureau of Investigation must revise their 1977 agreement on accident investigations to incorporate the amendments made by this section. The revised agreement must be submitted to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate. Technical amendments were made to Section 1131(a)(2) of title 49, United States Code by moving subparagraphs (B) and (C) 4 ems to the left. This was passed by the House of Representatives on May 15, 2003.
